title: Methodology for Analyzing Cognitive Load and Emotional Changes in Multimedia Learning Material Design

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory multimedia learning experience and foundational knowledge in social sciences
context.additional_context: Learners analyze text-image hybrid materials in a self-paced viewing environment using digital devices and conduct learning effectiveness evaluations based on EEG and eye-tracking data.

learning_goals: Can explain alpha-frequency band power analysis methods as EEG biomarkers for measuring cognitive load and emotional changes in multimedia learning materials.
Can evaluate the design effectiveness of learning materials by applying Fixation-Related Brain Potential (FRBP) methodology for EEG data analysis based on fixation events.
Can execute procedures to quantitatively analyze the correlation between visual element arrangement and cognitive processing in learning materials.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
